content.description:
The wildest and most exposed pitch around.

a quick scramble and 60 feet of 5.6 arete climbing take you to a horizontal break with bail anchors. Take a deep breath, clip the bail anchors with a long runner, and cruise out 15 feet of well featured HORIZONTAL ARETE CLIMBING, on the "hatchet blade". The prow stays around 45 degrees for another 10 feet, and then remains vertical to the very top of the beautiful formation. One of so many inspiring Skinner routes.
content.protection:
12 quickdraws and maybe one long runner. rings at the top.

You can lower with a 60, depending on where you stand to belay. KNOT THE END of your rope anyway.

Don't leave hanging draws here, or at least make sure they're dull colored. see comment.
content.location: This line takes the very edge of the hatchet blade shaped prow at Suicide Point.

content.description: A 20 foot, horizontal pocketed roof is broken by two routes. Stormbringer follows a 5.9 dihedral with jamming, stemming, and face holds to the base of the roof with a bail locker.  Then the route tackles the longest part of the roof on deep but spaced pockets.  A shorter 12b, Cloudwalker, goes right.
content.location: On the right side of the crag, find a dihedral leading to a huge pocketed roof.

content.description: A short, fingery warm up for wind drinker and the other harder routes at suicide point.
A dark, sharp, and overhanging 8 inch offwidth heads up a left facing corner to a juggy wall.  It's a good thing there's pockets the whole way.  Fun climbing.
Climb the vertical wall with a seam, and then the short steep face with a hard one-move crux.
content.location: The steep face to the left of Painless (5.9) holds two routes.  The route up the blank right side of the face is Flowers for a Dead Man (13b).  Blue steel is to the left.

content.description: Climb the irregular crack which is sharp and mostly big hands.  At the top more face holds and a little ledge appear.  Fun but strange, the only established trad route at a remote sport cliff.  No-one brings cams here, but bring a few for this one if interested.
content.protection:
2 or 3 bolts.  Bring hand sized cams.

No anchor.  take it to the top and belay the 2nd on gear.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Painless.  Another crack/corner system.

content.description: Begins with a few hard slab/vertical moves past a good mono near the first bolt. Then into nice pockets, a few large side pulls and onto a large jug rail. From the rail it continues up a steep wall on good jugs to a big ledge with anchors.
content.protection: Bolts to a two bolt anchor. Suggest stick clipping the first. Crux is low.
content.location: Right most route on the main wind drinker feature.
